Articles.Content:
I downloaded some mods: Hyperedit, Kerbpaint, Kerbal Engineer, and BDArmoury.

Kerbpaint doesn't work (just won't respond)

BDArmoury doesn't work (all parts are static and do nothing)

Hyperedit mostly works (after 3 landings it advised me not to land anywhere else (What Why?) I did it anyway and the ship exploded)

Kerbal Engineer works

The result: I am trapped in modder's limbo, Only being able to use stock parts and limited extra features. I have a feeling that this is because i have installed out-of-date mods (though i remember them being current). I will reinstall them and see.

Just something funny that happened

Edited September 10, 2015 by quasarrgames

Kerbal Engineer kinda works (Thrust-to-weight ratio is usually off by 10-15% in editor (not much, but still not ideal))
If you're looking for on-pad TWR click the Atmospheric button at the top of the Engineer window.

Hyperedit kinda works (after 3 landings it advised me not to land anywhere else (What Why?) I did it anyway and the ship exploded)

Explosive behaviour is a thing when you land directly on other planet. Place the ship into orbit of a body before landing on it.
Ohhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhh... Forgot about atmospheric thrust scaling. whoops

do you need some plugin like modulemanager or firespitter or some random thing like that? Kerbal Engineer redux works out the err zip file thing. check over the mods forum page for dependencies & good luck i dont use those other mods :/
